val:
D A E D a e

D A E The plains roll forever D a e
and we’re too few to count the days D A E in my dreams I can remember D A E a time when we weren’t afriad

G A its hard to say what happened

its hard to know for sure

but the letters that you opened

with intentions to restore

can only cause confusion

with their memories so pure

The highway lights the question asked a thousand times since youth and a thousand answers in contention fight like children to be called the truth

I like to think I’ve given more than I took away with the distance I have driven for some reason we can’t quite say I could only call confusion in the this addleworn age
